column4: I am using Ubuntu Karmic with latest flash 10 and only the flock browser is not detecting the flash plug in, apparently it's asking for installation of flash from adobe's website, one new thing I've found the plug in is not in the 'plug in' list of flock, How to active flash plug in? (in Flock)
Quan-time: yes, I have already placed one question on Flock help community, and now  I am going to put another one in Adobe's site...cause I think everything should 'fairly' support Ubuntu/linux!!
Actually I have another critical question
I have one server running on my IP, but I don't host any servers (don't want to..), so how to kill that unknown server, which is currently insecure I believe...
somebody told me about 'sudo killall apache/apache2' but it's nothing spacial for me :(

I have one server running on my IP, but I don't host any servers (don't want to..), so how to kill that unknown server, which is currently insecure I believe...somebody told me about 'sudo killall apache/apache2' but it's nothing spacial for me :(
no there are no 'apache' word in the little list
so why do you think you have an apache server running?
actually in ##teenlinux one guy just told me that my IP has one server (and it's right, I checked), and he told me that your apache server is running, and gave me the command
unless you have actually installed apache it wont be on your box as default
could be anything answering.. GUI on your router or similar
doesnt have to be your ubuntu
well we have established that there is no web server running on your ubuntu, so you should look elsewhere.. my guess is your router
i do in fact see what appears to be an apache answering on your ip: 117.194.3.130
and you only have one box?
